Articles.Content:
Hi all,

 When ingame at the KSP or anywhere on Kerbin ichave a strange sound in the background. It sounds like wind on a microphone with some quiet crackles in there too. 

I have a new install of windows, an xfi sound card if that helps.

There's no weird sounds as far as I know, did you try restarting?

Please check your logs for any error entries ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> There's no weird sounds as far as I know, did you try restarting?
> Please check your logs for any error entries ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Yup sound persists. No error logs at all.

[http://soundcloud.com/brian-primm-3/kerbal-1-0-audio-crackle](https://soundcloud.com/brian-primm-3/kerbal-1-0-audio-crackle)

Is this it? Same problem here.

> 
> [http://soundcloud.com/brian-primm-3/kerbal-1-0-audio-crackle](https://soundcloud.com/brian-primm-3/kerbal-1-0-audio-crackle)
> Is this it? Same problem here.

Yes that's the sound I hear... Do you have a dedicated soundcard?

> 
> [http://soundcloud.com/brian-primm-3/kerbal-1-0-audio-crackle](https://soundcloud.com/brian-primm-3/kerbal-1-0-audio-crackle)
> Is this it? Same problem here.

I have similar audio glitches, though not as frequent. 

I think the wind-like sound is intentional (ambient sound).

> 
> I have similar audio glitches, though not as frequent. 
> I think the wind-like sound is intentional (ambient sound).

Yes I can hear ambient wind sound plus those glitchy sounds..

No, it's an X99 Deluxe MB by ASUS. I've never had any audio issues and I've been playing since 0.23

The ambient sound is too loud, I can picture maybe birds or something, but this sounds like an engine was left on. The crackles are the most annoying part.

> 
> No, it's an X99 Deluxe MB by ASUS. I've never had any audio issues and I've been playing since 0.23
> The ambient sound is too loud, I can picture maybe birds or something, but this sounds like an engine was left on. The crackles are the most annoying part.

Hmm. I tried reinstalling the game and the issue still remains on a stock install.. This is very annoying. How the hell do we fix this??
Turning music down to 0% worked for me.

> 
> Turning music down to 0% worked for me.

Really? That fixed the popping crackle sound? \*fires up KSP\* Nope that didn't help..

 Anyone have any ideas?

> 
> [http://soundcloud.com/brian-primm-3/kerbal-1-0-audio-crackle](https://soundcloud.com/brian-primm-3/kerbal-1-0-audio-crackle)
> Is this it? Same problem here.

Have you had any luck fixing this?
What about ambient noise? There's some background wind noise that may be causing this.

> 
> What about ambient noise? There's some background wind noise that may be causing this.

What about the ambient noise? Indeed, when I lower the ambient noise volume to 0 I cannot hear the glitchy sounds. 

A fix however seems unlikely.. It must be some kind of hardware thing. My PC has a fresh install of windows and all new drivers..

So if you can't hear it with ambient at zero, it's an ambient noise in the game and in-game sounds can be replaced by some addons.

So someone could fix this...

I'm not hearing this, but sometimes (intermittent) when I change from/to map view I get a short ftt which sounds rather like you are z x ing a mono engine. If this error deserves a separate thread happy to create one...

> 
> So if you can't hear it with ambient at zero, it's an ambient noise in the game and in-game sounds can be replaced by some addons.
> So someone could fix this...

It is definitely a bug. I hear the ambient wind sound which I like but also another glitchy sound. It is exactly like the file posted on the first page.

<iframe width="100%" height="400" scrolling="no"></iframe> 

 I will look for ambient sound mods. I haven't seen any though so far..
